title: Seven Falls 2014 GPS Series Stone Tree Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)
description: High-toned aromas of spice, black fruit and red apple are followed by dark coffee and pitch-black cherry flavors that show a lot of barrel influence. There's enjoyment to be had but this wine seems a little heavy handed.

title: Villa Yambol 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)
description: Inky purple in the glass, this wine has aromas of cherry, vanilla and black berry. It is medium bodied in the mouth, with flavors of black plum and blueberry syrup. Brown baking spices show before the persistent finish.

title: Villa Yambol 2015 Mavrud (Thracian Valley)
description: This ink-colored wine has aromas of cranberry juice, candied violets and finely ground black pepper. Characteristic flavors of tart cherry, cranberry and pomegranate lead to just a touch of vanilla in the finish.

title: Three Rivers 2014 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Unique, high-toned aromas of freshly peeled orange, potpourri, clove and blue fruit lead to lighter styled, tart, plentiful plum flavors. This wine doesn't stand up on its own but should fit in well at the dinner table.

title: Don Tony Perez 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: Pastry notes blend with ripe berry aromas and hints of vanilla and raisin. This is rubbery and tannic in feel, with flavors of cherry, plum, cassis and herbal spice. On the finish, an herbal flavor note is typical of Chilean Cabernet.

title: Doqi 2014 Qveri Kisi (Georgia)
description: Don't be fooled by this honey-colored wine's simple nose of clementine. It offers a complex palate of green apple, guava and honeydew melon bolstered by soft floral notes. Strong tannins make their presence known on the gums and tongue, but any sense of grippiness is overcome by the bright citrus finish.

title: Feudo Maccari 2015 Family and Friends Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, hazelnut and espresso lead the nose. The oak sensations carry over to the firm palate, along with candied citrus zest, butterscotch, yellow-apple skin and a confectionery note.

title: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2015 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)
description: Pure bright smoky fruits give this wine its edge of tannin and great red plum and spice flavors. Its youth adds a dry character to the fruitiness and acidity. Drink this from 2018.

title: Yamhill Valley 2015 Pinot Gris (McMinnville)
description: This brings a lively mix of green citrus and green banana, with a light streak of white peach. All in all, it's balanced and fresh, though it falls on the lighter side, despite the generous finished alcohol.

title: WesMar 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light in color, with delicate raspberry and strawberry fruit, this is light-bodied and ethereal, quietly revealing pops of dried herb, clove and rose.

title: Château Les Hauts de Palette 2016 Château Haut Mondain Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: There is a great burst of appealing acidity in this wine, accompanied by refreshing red fruits. This balanced wine is lively, crisp and with plenty of flavor. Drink now.

title: Château Magondeau 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Olivier Doujon made only 7,000 bottles of this 100% Merlot at the family estate in Fronsac. Rounded and ripe, this is a full-bodied wine with great fruitiness and attractive acidity. Well balanced, it offers red-cherry flavors with an edge of pepper. Drink the wine now.

title: Château Reynon 2016 Le Rosé de Floridène Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This is a real food wine, with its tangy texture, touch of spice and attractive acidity. Light fruitiness and a dry core give a structured character. Drink now.

title: Château Terres Douces 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This is a crisp wine, full of acidity. It holds the potential of crisp green and citrus fruits that are developing. A nutty edge contrasts with the tense acidity. Drink from late 2017.

title: Cherry Tart 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: Big and flavorful, this full-bodied wine boasts butter, toast and smoke nuances layered over ripe pear and marzipan flavors. Fermented in stainless steel but aged in French oak, it has a rich texture and overt sweetness without going to extremes.

title: Child's Play 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a pretty wine, forward and fruit-driven, with orange-juice highlights around cherry fruit. It's as fresh and flavorful as a Cru Beaujolais, ready for immediate enjoyment and best consumed sometime this decade.

title: Clarendelle 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This lively wine comes from the Clarence Dillon group (Château Haut-Brion). It offers good balance between the considerable acidity and the red-berry fruit. With its spicy background, the wine is delicious to drink now.

title: Claudio Quarta 2016 Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)
description: Made entirely with the native grape Negroamaro, this opens with intriguing aromas of Mediterranean scrub, dill and red berry. The vibrant palate shows sour cherry, strawberry, tangerine and dried herb alongside crisp acidity that lends a refreshing finish.

title: Contrada Salandra 2014 Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)
description: Citrus zest, toasted nut, Mediterranean scrub and honey aromas follow over to the refined palate along with yellow apple and a hint of ginger. Bright acidity and a saline note give it a fresh, savory finish.

title: Corte Giacobbe 2016  Soave
description: Aromas of grapefruit and crushed tomato vine lead the nose. The ripe rounded palate offers honeydew melon, lemon drop and a note of crushed dill alongside fresh acidity.

title: Deaver 2016 Chardonnay (Amador County)
description: This fruit-forward wine shows crisp apple and orange blossom aromas and loads of juicy lemon and pineapple flavors. It's full bodied, ultraripe, and lush, albeit a touch sweet and low in acidity.

title: 14 Hands 2015 Reserve Late Harvest Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: The aromas are somewhat light considering the variety and style, with notes of orange peel and flower. It drinks sweet, finishing with orange flavors. It's enjoyable but the concentration doesn't seem all there.

title: 29 & Oak Wines 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With mild red fruit, baked plum accents and a lackluster structure, this wine, blended with 10% Merlot, is big and dense.

title: Adega Mãe 2016 Dory White (Lisboa)
description: With Anselmo Mendes, the Vinho Verde master, as consultant, this is a coastal Lisboa wine that has plenty of the crisp texture that comes from the Alvarinho in the blend. There is a perfumed touch from Viognier, giving the wine crispness as well as a rich background. Drink this wine from 2018.

title: Animale 2014 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Listed as well in excess of 15% alcohol, this is sourced from a single vineyard in a hot year. The grapes were left to hang while sugars rose precipitously. Flavors suggest mincemeat pie, brown sugar and root beer. Not typical, but tasty enough. Drink over the next year for peak flavor.

title: Auclair 2014 Right Blend Artz Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)
description: Merlot and Cabernet Franc make up equal parts of this blend. Aromas are up front, with notes of baking spice, dates, anise and slightly dried-out fruit. Dark-cherry flavors bring a sense of concentration and enjoyment.

title: Barton & Guestier 2016 Passeport Bordeaux Blanc by Laurent Prada  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Lightly perfumed, this soft, ripe wine has attractive acidity that is balanced by ripe yellow- and white-stone fruits. The acidity at the end is just right. Drink now.
designation: Passeport Bordeaux Blanc by Laurent Prada

title: Benoît Daridan 2015 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Cheverny)
description: From one of the leading producers in this small appellation in the central Loire Valley, the wine is lightly herbal, perfumed and with a fine balance between its crisp texture, citrus fruit and the riper touch of apricots. Drink now.

title: Calera 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Crisp nectarine and apricot aromas meet hints of butter and lime in this clean and easy appellation blend from seven vineyards and four counties. The flavors are also familiar and pleasant, with key lime and lemon peel and a building acidity that carries those flavors deep into the finish.

title: Cantine Astroni 2015 Imperatrice Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)
description: Here's a fragrant white that opens with aromas of spring blossom, orchard fruit and a whiff of brimstone. On the bright juicy palate, a savory saline note energizes yellow apple, Bartlett pear and lemon zest.
